posts.html:

posts.title: Fuze
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"OVERVIEW"],[1,[],0,0],[1,[],0,1]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[],0,"The Fuze platform lets users quickly look through large amounts of data and still maintain the privacy dictated by the original data owner. Fuse is made up or 4 components:"],[1,[],0,2],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"\t - Access + Search: instantly search through vast amounts of data only \t\tsee the data where you have permissions"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"\t- Query + Enrich: sort, filter and query tables to return snapshots"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"\t- Discovery + Understand: browse through data in seconds to find the \t\tdata you're looking for"],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"\t- Collaborate + Create: publish data back to the platform or build the \t\tnew app using Fuze data via the Fuze API"]]],[1,"p",[]],[1,"p",[]],[1,"p",[]]],"ghostVersion":"4.0"}
posts.html:
OVERVIEW

The Fuze platform lets users quickly look through large amounts of data and still maintain the privacy dictated by the original data owner. Fuse is made up or 4 components:

- Access + Search: instantly search through vast amounts of data only see the data where you have permissions
- Query + Enrich: sort, filter and query tables to return snapshots
- Discovery + Understand: browse through data in seconds to find the data you're looking for
- Collaborate + Create: publish data back to the platform or build the new app using Fuze data via the Fuze API
posts.plaintext:
OVERVIEW



The Fuze platform lets users quickly look through large amounts of data and still maintain the privacy dictated by the original data owner. Fuse is made up or 4 components:

- Access + Search: instantly search through vast amounts of data only see the data where you have permissions
- Query + Enrich: sort, filter and query tables to return snapshots
- Discovery + Understand: browse through data in seconds to find the data you're looking for
- Collaborate + Create: publish data back to the platform or build the new app using Fuze data via the Fuze API
posts.custom_excerpt: A platform where we can easily, safely, and confidently share diverse data.

posts.title: Iris
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"OVERVIEW"],[1,[],0,0]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[],0,"Iris is a circular bar chart that looks at plasma center data with a focus on patients and donors. The visualization is designed to help users have conversations with their data - to look at different types of data granularity, search across time, and encourage empathy through the humanization of data."],[1,[],0,1],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Iris also serves as the first application to be built on top of the data platform Fue, another Diffusion Labs project."]]]],"ghostVersion":"4.0"}
posts.html:
OVERVIEW

Iris is a circular bar chart that looks at plasma center data with a focus on patients and donors. The visualization is designed to help users have conversations with their data - to look at different types of data granularity, search across time, and encourage empathy through the humanization of data.

Iris also serves as the first application to be built on top of the data platform Fue, another Diffusion Labs project.
posts.plaintext:
OVERVIEW


Iris is a circular bar chart that looks at plasma center data with a focus on patients and donors. The visualization is designed to help users have conversations with their data - to look at different types of data granularity, search across time, and encourage empathy through the humanization of data.

Iris also serves as the first application to be built on top of the data platform Fue, another Diffusion Labs project.
posts.custom_excerpt: A data visualization to start having meaningful conversations with plasma center data

posts.title: Kickstarting Plasma Innovation at the Edge (PIE)
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"OVERVIEW"],[1,[],0,0]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[],0,"As a brand new program, PIE sets to bring different groups within CSL together to pursue breakthrough opportunities across the plasma space - whether it's on the donor floor, product development, or anywhere else."],[1,[],0,1],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Diffusion Labs contributed heavily to this initial phase of the program, create templates and guides"],[1,[],0,3],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"\t- Project governance - research and implement best practices, create templates and guides"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"\t- User-centered workshop - gather pain points and brainstorm ideas to help seed the list of initial projects for the program"],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"\t- Deep analysis to identify the most suitable academic institutions for partnership, considering PIE's goals and research agenda"]]],[1,"p",[]]],"ghostVersion":"4.0"}
posts.html:
OVERVIEW

As a brand new program, PIE sets to bring different groups within CSL together to pursue breakthrough opportunities across the plasma space - whether it's on the donor floor, product development, or anywhere else.

Diffusion Labs contributed heavily to this initial phase of the program, create templates and guides

- Project governance - research and implement best practices, create templates and guides
- User-centered workshop - gather pain points and brainstorm ideas to help seed the list of initial projects for the program
- Deep analysis to identify the most suitable academic institutions for partnership, considering PIE's goals and research agenda
posts.plaintext:
OVERVIEW


As a brand new program, PIE sets to bring different groups within CSL together to pursue breakthrough opportunities across the plasma space - whether it's on the donor floor, product development, or anywhere else.

Diffusion Labs contributed heavily to this initial phase of the program, create templates and guides

- Project governance - research and implement best practices, create templates and guides
- User-centered workshop - gather pain points and brainstorm ideas to help seed the list of initial projects for the program
- Deep analysis to identify the most suitable academic institutions for partnership, considering PIE's goals and research agenda
posts.custom_excerpt: Plasma Innovation at the Edge is a joint program created by I&T, Plasma End-to-End, and R&D's Plasma Protein Development. Diffusion Labs represents I&T and has helped throughout from early stage designs to leading a workshop to seed the charter candidate projects.

posts.title: Digital Twins
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"OVERVIEW"],[1,[],0,0]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[],0,"The Plasma center digital twin is viewable as a graphical model of plasma collection center. The model reflects the real-time status of the center thanks to a range of active data streams from different systems and sensors."],[1,[],0,1],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"This model plasma center can be used to monitor activity in real-time, test operational simulations, or even conduct immersive trainings"]]]],"ghostVersion":"4.0"}
posts.html:
OVERVIEW

The Plasma center digital twin is viewable as a graphical model of plasma collection center. The model reflects the real-time status of the center thanks to a range of active data streams from different systems and sensors.

This model plasma center can be used to monitor activity in real-time, test operational simulations, or even conduct immersive trainings
posts.plaintext:
OVERVIEW


The Plasma center digital twin is viewable as a graphical model of plasma collection center. The model reflects the real-time status of the center thanks to a range of active data streams from different systems and sensors.

This model plasma center can be used to monitor activity in real-time, test operational simulations, or even conduct immersive trainings
posts.custom_excerpt: A virtual representation reflecting the real-time status and events of a plasma center

posts.title: Automated Medical Processes
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"OVERVIEW"],[1,[],0,0]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[],0,"This project, which is part of the PIE program, explores the opportunities of using automation techniques to:"],[1,[],0,1],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"\t- Reduce in-person activities and assessments"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"\t- Decrease the donor's time in the center"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"\t- Standardize process performance and outcomes"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"\t- Increase donation quality and overall donor experience"],[1,[],0,6],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"The core solution technologies under consideration are computer vision, augmented reality, and robotics. Some examples include:"],[1,[],0,8],[1,[],0,9],[0,[],0,"\t- Using computer vision to inspect donor's arms to identify bruising and needle marks or ORCAM for donors that have difficulty reading"],[1,[],0,10],[0,[],0,"\t- Using an AR-assissted device during vein detection to prep and perform phlebotomies"],[1,[],0,11],[0,[],0,"\t- Following advances in robotic venipuncture to detect early signals of commercial viability and accelerate pathways for collaborations, trials, or future use in collection centers"]]]],"ghostVersion":"4.0"}
posts.html:
OVERVIEW

This project, which is part of the PIE program, explores the opportunities of using automation techniques to:

- Reduce in-person activities and assessments
- Decrease the donor's time in the center
- Standardize process performance and outcomes
- Increase donation quality and overall donor experience

The core solution technologies under consideration are computer vision, augmented reality, and robotics. Some examples include:

- Using computer vision to inspect donor's arms to identify bruising and needle marks or ORCAM for donors that have difficulty reading
- Using an AR-assissted device during vein detection to prep and perform phlebotomies
- Following advances in robotic venipuncture to detect early signals of commercial viability and accelerate pathways for collaborations, trials, or future use in collection centers
posts.plaintext:
OVERVIEW


This project, which is part of the PIE program, explores the opportunities of using automation techniques to:

- Reduce in-person activities and assessments
- Decrease the donor's time in the center
- Standardize process performance and outcomes
- Increase donation quality and overall donor experience

The core solution technologies under consideration are computer vision, augmented reality, and robotics. Some examples include:

- Using computer vision to inspect donor's arms to identify bruising and needle marks or ORCAM for donors that have difficulty reading
- Using an AR-assissted device during vein detection to prep and perform phlebotomies
- Following advances in robotic venipuncture to detect early signals of commercial viability and accelerate pathways for collaborations, trials, or future use in collection centers
posts.custom_excerpt: With the help of computer vision robotics, automate as much as possible to save time, improve the donor experience, and improve donation quality.

posts.title: What is it like as an engineer at a BioTech company
Donor Management System (DMS) Exploration
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"h3",[[0,[],0,"OVERVIEW"],[1,[],0,0]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[],0,"Diffusion Labs, along with colleagues in CSl Plasma, dug into the donor management software space to think through what the future state of a DMS should like and what additional opportunities exist with solutions in similar spaces, such as Electronic Medical Records (EMRs)."],[1,[],0,1],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"This research includes looking at the competitive landscape for plasma and other health-related industries, market reports, as well as meeting with different vendors. While there are no concrete conclusions yet since the work is still ongoing, a current view of our analysis and opinions is available for a broader audience here (need to include link... and get some clearance) "]]]],"ghostVersion":"4.0"}
posts.html:
OVERVIEW

Diffusion Labs, along with colleagues in CSl Plasma, dug into the donor management software space to think through what the future state of a DMS should like and what additional opportunities exist with solutions in similar spaces, such as Electronic Medical Records (EMRs).

This research includes looking at the competitive landscape for plasma and other health-related industries, market reports, as well as meeting with different vendors. While there are no concrete conclusions yet since the work is still ongoing, a current view of our analysis and opinions is available for a broader audience here (need to include link... and get some clearance)
posts.plaintext:
OVERVIEW


Diffusion Labs, along with colleagues in CSl Plasma, dug into the donor management software space to think through what the future state of a DMS should like and what additional opportunities exist with solutions in similar spaces, such as Electronic Medical Records (EMRs).

This research includes looking at the competitive landscape for plasma and other health-related industries, market reports, as well as meeting with different vendors. While there are no concrete conclusions yet since the work is still ongoing, a current view of our analysis and opinions is available for a broader audience here (need to include link... and get some clearance)

posts_meta.meta_description: Under review, starting as early as July 2022

Market research project to identify and evaluate existing Donor Management System (DMS) providers
